Class ContentHandler

Direct Known Subclasses:
InvokeProtocol, ServiceProtocol
public class ContentHandler
extends java.lang.Thread

Author:
Igor Androsov ContentHandler implementation. This class must be extended to implement the socket protocol

Constructor Detail

ContentHandler

public ContentHandler()
Empty constructor. When using this constructor, it is necessary to call the setSocket(Socket s) method to set the accpeted socket connection into the class. It is also necessary call the setSocketListener(SocketListener sl) to set the listener object, as this object contains thread configurations.

executeServiceSynch

public com.wm.data.IData executeServiceSynch(java.lang.String folder,
                                             java.lang.String service,
                                             com.wm.data.IData input)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Execute the IS service in synchronous mode. It is possible ro receive data from the IS service.

Parameters:
folder - Folder where the service is
service - Service name
input - Input IData object
Returns:
Output IData object
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Thrown if any error occours

executeServiceAsynch

public void executeServiceAsynch(java.lang.String folder,
                                 java.lang.String service,
                                 com.wm.data.IData input)
                          throws com.wm.app.b2b.server.ISRuntimeException
Execute the IS service in asynchronous mode. Used when it is not necessary to receive any data from the invoked service.

Parameters:
folder - Folder where the service is
service - Service name
input - Input IData object
Throws:
com.wm.app.b2b.server.ISRuntimeException
